knimeNode.name: Database Table Exists IF Switch (Flow Variable Output)
knimeNode.shortDescription: IF Switch node with active branch based on whether the database connection contains the specified table

fullDescription.intro:
IF Switch node with active branch based on whether the database connection contains the specified table. The outputs are a flow variable ports to allow branch switching
This node was developed by Vernalis Research . For feedback and more information, please contact
knime@vernalis.com
fullDescription.option: the name of the table to check, which may include the namespace. If no namespace is included then the namespace will not be checked

If this option is selected, then the check will be performed in a case-insensitive manner. Otherwise the check is case sensitive, but that is subject to the case sensitivity rules implemented in the JDBC connector for the database
The table types to check for the table. By default, this is restricted to tables and views

If this option is selected, then the output ports are enabled/disabled during configure as well as during node execution (the result may be different between those times), otherwise the setting is only applied during node execution phase, and both ports remain active on the unexecuted node

ports.outPort: Active flow variable port if table exists in database connection
Active flow variable port if table does not exist in database connection
